alert.note: Alert for Adair; Cherokee; Delaware; Mayes; Muskogee; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 04 at 10:35PM CDT until May 05 at 3:30AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Cherokee County in east central Oklahoma... Northeastern Muskogee County in east central Oklahoma... Northern Adair County in northeastern Oklahoma... Southern Delaware County in northeastern Oklahoma... Southern Mayes County in northeastern Oklahoma... Wagoner County in northeastern Oklahoma... * Until 330 AM CDT. * At 1035 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain moving into the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain fell earlier today. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Muskogee... Tahlequah... Wagoner... Jay... Fort Gibson... Chouteau... Westville... Locust Grove... Salina... West Siloam Springs... Colcord... Kansas... Okay... Hulbert... Porter... Watts... Oaks... Tullahassee... Peggs... Rose... FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Adair; Cherokee; Delaware; Mayes; Muskogee; Wagoner
